title: Let's calmly discuss Soraka's kit
body:
THIS KIT IS A PILE OF...interestingness
Lost post ahead!
TL;DR version: I'm OK with the kit so far but everything is riding on her Q being effective.



I've been going back and forth with this kit and a lot of people have been more than happy to smash this idea to pieces even before it reaches the PBE. Most of it has been revolved around her second passive mainly and pretty much been judged based on it. But now it seems people are noticing some other things about her kit that people have been very worried about.

So I wanna talk about her ENTIRE kit this time instead of just her passive. I will be critical at some points but it's going to be moreover positive outlook at this kit...again. Sorry, if you're hoping that I'll join the bandwagon of shitting on this kit. Get ready for disappointment.

I will be saving Q for last though because I found out about something that, simply put, pissed me off.
[Here is Sorakas kit on the [Board](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/BTP5uwf1-this-rework-is-going-to-be-bananas-soraka-rework-preview-and-discussion)]
*********************
Let's start off with her Passive
Her first one, no comment. Everyone loves this idea and has spawned WEEE WOO WEE WOO. Now we are just waiting on a paramedic Soraka skin. It has to come true, don't let us down Riot.

Her second passive...well, I already talked about it[ here](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4828918&highlight=) and Vesh was able to give us some more insight into why this was implemented in that thread as well. Personally, this is just a new and radical idea that will obviously be looked at with a negative point of view. I **THINK** it can work but the only way we will know once the goat lady has arrived in the PBE.
******************
Skipping Q and going straight to W.

Now the biggest issue with this ability is that Soraka will be using 10% of her max health. This was created to simply stop Soraka from building tanky but also create an actual trade of sorts. I'll argue that it acts more like a transfer of damage of sorts. The damage applied didn't go away it simply went to the wrong person you wanted to kill. Also the interation between Q and W helps delete the damage. Let's go through some complaints:
1. She can only heal 10 times.\ Not if she brings a few health potions. Not if she acquires a few health regen items (although itemization is rather poor for this). Not if she lands her Q. Not if she  acquires either Crucible or GA. There are plenty of things Soraka can do so she can heal more than just 10 times. It's tricky but it's doable. Then again, if she could get it easily, people would call this kit cancerous.
2. Champions like Sona and Nami can outheal her. Heck even alister could outheal her.\ I agree, champions like Sona and Nami could outheal Soraka...in the long run. But in short burst however, Soraka would leave the other sustain champions in the dust...at least, I think that will be the case. Sure Sona and Nami could heal a champion to max health but Soraka would be able to do it far faster. This is only assuming a Soraka player isn't trying to get that health back somehow in the process of healing her allies.
I will admit that 10% is rather pricy but if Soraka does scale well with ap, I believe the health she will sacrifice will be on the small side compared to how much she heals her allies.I will also admit the amount of gating they put on this heal is rather heavy: health/mana/CD on her Q.
****************
Alright on to her E

A lot of people are sad to see the mana restoration to go away. I too will be sad to see it go as well. It really was a unique ability that no other champion could call their own. But at this point, I'm simply preaching to the choir. But lets look at the positives this new E will bring.

For starters this is also a unique ability on its own as well. Many people thought Riot was trying to get rid of silence with how previous champions have had theirs taken away, Leblanc anyone? This is an ability that creates an AOE silence field that after it is done, roots any enemy left in it. I don't think any other champion can say they can do that. I mean, finally people can't flash or dash out of Jarvan's ult anymore if Soraka is on his team. I will admit that 24 second CD is rather large (too large) but I think this is just Riot erring on the side of caution. I really do hope they bring it down a bit because of the fact she only has a few CC abilities and only one ability that causes damage. 
I'm kinda curious as to why equinox does not do damage as well, at least during the root part. Although, if it did do damage, it might create some serious wave clearing potential. So that could be a reason.

******
Now to her R

Nothing much has changed about her ult except it gaining more power for each ally below 40%. I really wished (hue) that Soraka armor buff would've been transferred to her ult. Even if it sounds OP, I would've loved for it to be on here. Other than that, So far so good.

*******
Now to the big one. The one ability I think will either have her kit be successful or be an utter failure. Her Q.

This ability has a 10 second CD, a kinda weak CC, the healing capabilities are only effective on enemy champions, and is more reliable using at close range...
I find that last part the most rediculous. I may be reading this part wrong but I feel like due to Soraka is going to be really squishy and probably going to juggle her health bar a lot, why would you make an ability that has a 10 second CD difficult to land at long range? I really need to see this ability in action because I can deal with all of her entire kit except for that little bit. She's already loaded with a lot of things to juggle and I feel like Riot is trying to load her with as much counterplay simply because they are afraid of a core healer. 
I understand that you should make it kinda difficult to delete her own damage, elsewise she will become OP and unfun. But this does not feel like difficulty to me, it feels more like a punishment. Now if landing her Q goes from ridiculously easy to land at short range to it requires actual skill to land then I think I am ok with that. 
If this ability is on a 10 second CD then it shouldn't be really difficult to land. I would really like it if I can hurt enemy minions or jungle creep and heal up a bit at a reduced price if it's going to be on a 10 second CD. That way I can chose to either go for a cheap easy heal or risk going for a more powerful heal.
I could be overreacting about this ability and once she hits the PBE then it will all make sense but right now this seems really wrong. She already has a lot of counterplay on her kit and if her Q is unreliable at long range then this just feels unfair.
Also I really hope that CC can, at least, scale up some more because I feel like 20% is kinda weak if someone is right on your a[B]s[/B]s.
Of course, with all that said, this could be for the sake of making the laning phase fair. If someone is capable of deleting any damage you make it should be difficult on their part to keep doing that. I felt like ranting about this part of her kit but I might be simply overlooking something.
*******
Well, that's pretty much it. Besides her Q, I feel kinda alright with her kit. I might be overreacting with her Q and it could work. Except for that CC, I really think that needs to scale up. Now if you have gotten through all of this, Congratulations! Feel free to tell me how wrong I am and how stupid it is to even put faith in this kit. You've earned that much for taking the time to read my post.

replies.body: I'm still holding off on making my thoughts on her new kit until the full numbers are revealed.

This is a good mindset. A lot of this Soraka playstyle comes down to the number tuning. You will be able to test it on PBE soon. 

So far we have seen both the version where Soraka is an unstoppable self healing god with Q, and we have also seen the Soraka that struggles to stay above 50%. In the end we want her to be able to stay pretty topped if she is playing well, but if Qs are missing, she will see the costs stick.

I don't really have to wait, since the only point I absolutely hate and consider utterly unacceptable, is both already given numbers for, and I consider it wrong on principle.

I'm talking of course about Soraka converting her resistances into AP without an opt-out mechanic.

All characters in league have stats and scaling that are unique to them (see Magic Resist per level or Attack speed per level). 

Like the others, she doesn't get to opt in/out of this experience but its seems similar to the fact that ashe doesn't get to opt in to magic resist per level etc. 

What do you feel the character is losing because of this aspect of the passive? All characters have strengths and weaknesses and this is intended to accentuate her strengths and weaknesses.

I think the biggest concern is that Soraka's second passive is giving up too much armor/MR considering she may need every point in Armor/Mr just so she won't be instantly deleted.  I'm a little on the fence about it. She is getting Ap in return but she is losing something that she may need if she gets focused. 

I'm not saying it's a bad design idea, I've defended it. But that doesn't change the fact it's still kind of a scary concept of how she may be too squishy with this passive.

It's definitely scary - on this we agree. I think there's three conversation points:

1) I fundamentally believe if Soraka is allowed to get tanky, we'll have to gut her. This release valve is there to prevent this and allow her to be good.

2) New Soraka is both more narrow and more unique. Picking Soraka is very different than picking another support. If we want champions to have a unique strategic identity and have a reason "to be played," this is important.

3) The current passive can be tuned into obliteration if it's actually a problem, but we need a release valve. I know Soraka wants AR/MR/HP - that's why we have to discourage it or it will run afoul of 1), and Soraka will be gutted, and we might as well have not done anything and left her in the dumpster.

Tradeoffs are a huge component of good design, and sustainable champions. We've chosen these ones because we believe it will allow us to actually make a real healer character.

There is, strictly speaking, nothing wrong with any of your points. You're missing something, however. You are not releasing her in a vacuum. You're releasing her in a game where grievous wounds is a thing that is on at least two ADCs kits and is easy available with a summoner spell that is almost guaranteed to be on at least one member of the enemy team. You're releasing her in a game with assassins that can use her to refresh their cooldowns and them obliterate her carry. And you're releasing her in a game with a bunch of hyper mobile champs that can run circles around her and dodge all of her Qs.

I cannot say if her whole kit is bad, as I have not played it, but that passive is really worrying. You're giving every enemy team member 20% bonus armor and magic penetration on her. She's going to need amazing heals that don't automatically kill her to want to bring her into a match, especially in the current meta.

The heals are gonna be amazing.

And grievious wounds won't be here forever....
.

.
I hope... 
Im not with riot. I just like their work.

If GW is leaving, fucking finally, that's been terrible for years. Morello does appear to be saying as such, so that's good at least.

I'm still really wary of that passive, though. It's both really ugly and inelegant and makes me worry that she's going to only be good against non-mobile characters, leaving her a counterpick that cannot be picked in teambuilder or blind without running into 'well, the enemy mid is Katarina. gg'.
Good excuse to retire a bad mechanic, IMO (have to fix Swain/Mundo)

Not to get too off-topic, but about the change to Grievous Wounds: 
Right now, damage optimization falls into a couple core paths.
On-hit, high damage, Criticals, AP, High Penetration, Lifesteal/Spellvamp.
Onhit is countered by lowering attackspeed, or deflecting damage per-hit,
physical damage by armor, 
AP is countered through magic resist,
Penetration is beaten at low amounts by building defenses and at high amounts by NOT building defenses,
and Lifesteal and Spellvamp are shut down with Grievous Wounds.

So, in other words, whatever replaces Grievous Wounds, needs to be able to counter a 'siphon-heavy' build. I hope you can come up with something.

Also, there's very little to defend against Critical building (you basically have to treat it like high damage)

Stick your silence under a spinning kat and laugh. LAUGH!

Cant reset if you can't cast.
Soraka is likely to be niche, but its a kickass niche.

As for GW leaving, its the direction they have stated and it cant come quick enough in my opinion.

I hope you'll have time to cast the silence, given you're never at full health.

I'm never fond of just releasing kits without releasing them on the PBE to test. All I have to figure things out is the kit, and the problems I can see in the kit. I've been wrong before (I remember calling pre-s4 Taric 'weak' when they just released the changes. whoops.) and I'd really like an actual frame of reference to deal with.

It also means that the Rioters can just say 'well you need to be able to play it!' and when you finally can play it and give your informed feedback they're nowhere to be seen, but thankfully that doesn't appear to be happening here.

At least I hope not.

Hi Morello!

Oh, I had assumed she was hitting PBE first and just hadn't arrived yet. Shes skipping that step?

Oh god Pre-S4 taric was beautiful. I'm still sad he needed nerfed. Top lane bruiser taric was viable for once.

I doubt they're just releasing her on live without going through the PBE. Apparently from what I've read from a couple of red posts that's impossible with their current framework.

Whatever their plans are, she's not on the PBE right now, and it's been 7 days since they released the kit.

It's a mechanic that up until this point was considered harmful, and all but eradicated from kits that had stat loss included in any fashion(Blitz lost his exhaustion after Overdrive, Udyr can now crit in Turtle Stance, and those were both opt-out losses).

Except instead of being a result of themeing getting in the way of gameplay, it serves no other purpose than to force the players to always go for a certain type of durability(the self heal), and actively penalizing any attempts to break the mold.

No other character, should the passive go through, gets **less** of a stat that they want from the items they buy.
It takes away from the type of flexibility that to me defines League of Legends, and it dose so to a support character, a class that already struggles to take advantage of the breadth of options due to its limited access to gold.

But what if her healing is just so boss that she can't really be allowed to be tanky?

Thats what riot is saying and I personally don't care about soraka's durability. I care about her healing. If she can seriously keep folks healthy, an inability to become immortal through items is the price to be paid.
That's basically how insane her HPS and saving gets. It's unline anything we have on heals...2s Cooldown, high AP ratio, and big gains. You NEED to kill Soraka or a fight is unwinnable in this model.

What goes on in base stats is far different than what Soraka is going through here. She is the first case (That I know of) that BONUS stats are being reduced on her. Any other champion in the game gets face value or more from each piece of equipment they buy, with Soraka, you have to constantly try to remember and reduce every item's Armor and Mr you buy by 20% to actually know what you're getting.

It seems like a solution to dissuade her building tanky and abusing it, but it seems like a rather inelegant solution. It's setting a precedent on a champion in a way that's non-essential and I think if Riot were to add a "Descaling" mechanic with Bonus stats, it shouldn't be on Soraka.

Yes - this is the first time we've done that. My expectation is not that people get super excited about this, but instead it makes it so she can function and *not get kneecapped as soon as she's good*.

This design technique acts as a release valve for bullshit scenarios without requiring us to murder the core functions and unique abilities of the character. A Critical Guideline of Soraka is that she must be vulnerable to being killed while healing to allow her to be an insane health-refiller. This means we have to put preventative measures in there to ensure she stays what way - especially as items will be buffed/nerfed/added/removed long after Soraka's out.

So Soraka can't get tanky. That's the whole point.

Because letting the enemy Katarina go 'hey, I'm at half health all the time, feel free to use me to reset onto my carry!' is functioning as a support.

Not letting her  to self heal with W already functions as a way to allow her to get killed. Currently, she is punished for building any sorts of defensive stats, with either getting higher cost on her W or not getting all the benefit of it. Going glass cannon doesn't work when you're mobile, have no damage whatsoever, and are being put in a role where you are expected to build at least one health item, and maybe more.

I get that the idea is 'Soraka needs to be able to die' but in a game with instant gapclosing assassins she needs SOMETHING to avoid dying that isn't countered by buying a void staff/last whisper.

You do realize she has an AOE SILENCE RIGHT!? What katarina in her right mind would jump into a field of silence only to be snared at the end of it.

They wouldn't just remake Soraka a CORE HEALER  if they didn't think it would be possible. It just looks like Soraka is going to take some skill now. Which I am going to freaking love because as much as I love my Bi-ped unicorn, I get bored of her stale play-style sometimes. She's going to have strong heals, a mechanic to get some HP back and she will not be defenseless if she plays it right. There's a reason she needs to be vulnurable, because her ADC or whoever she's healing becomes a tank or so they make it seem. 

Just think about it. If you're afraid that someone is going to get close,  you have a little slow on Q, Rely on your ally to do the damage and just know that your safe in your silence zone. The closer they get, the easier it is to hit Q. This is a good scenario, and sure, she's going to be obliterated sometimes, but so does every other champion.

I have high hopes for this new kit and I'm SO EXCITED for the challenge, I do have concern like her mana consumption and what champions will counter her. But I'm hopeful, we will see when she's actually released on PBE.  ALTHOUGH, I'm scared how much she will be countered by grievous wounds... especially since healing is her core, and it's so easily countered by the purchase of an item. She might not have much to fall back on.

Because the Katarina thinks that she can obliterate the not-at-full-health before they can react? Remember, we are not bots. We do not have perfect reaction times.

A single slow is not enough as a defense in the game with so many gapclosers, especially one with a starting CD of 10 and a width of a single Karth Q. A silence field is not a good defense against ADCs, especially ones that are reliant on their autoattacks anyway.

I don't really think it's that hard to just anticipate when someone is going to jump in. And besides, did they ever say how close she has to be? Like I'm assuming she's going to  be behind the adc or something? IDK I'm just saying, lets see the kit first before it's knocked down because I think it seems promising and it's an improvement on the  current kit.

It matters because, with one rather confusing exception, your base stats don't affect your items. Ashe not having magic resist per level doesn't mean that she gets reduced benefit from buying a BVeil. While the extra stats do push her into certain builds, just like Yasuo and his two item full build, nothing has made buying a certain stat actively give you less of it before. 

There's also the fact that it takes up part of her passive, like it's a benefit. You don't see 'this champion gets no magic resist per level' in Ashe's passive, do you? That just makes it look worse.

wow.. you guys are giving the sona treatment to Soraka now eh? as if you guys didnt learn from the current sona loss rate... i mean win rate and non-pick stats since her rework and there you at rito still haven't reverted the "rework" or buffed her so she can ACTUALLY BE VIABLE ... well RIP soraka support she can go sit next to sona (who's gonna need a lore update and a buncha voice overs fix cuz of rito removing summoners from the lore "Only you can hear me Summoner.... Summoner?!") another "good job" done rito!

Riot has done probably at least 15-20 reworks, and every single one of them has turned out to be viable in solo queue.  The large majority of them even see competitive play at some junction.  Sometimes it takes a bit longer to fine tune them after release, but they have *never* idly left a rework in a poor state.

Give them time, there's no history here to support Riot failing at reworks, they have an incredibly high success rate from the perspective of viability.
olaf would love to say hello ... and thats all ill say to that

Olaf was played briefly in competitive after his rework.  I don't know why he fell off, but his rework put him in a spot that was good enough to be pick/ban worthy in [competitive play](http://lol.gamepedia.com/Riot_League_Championship_Series/North_America/2014_Season/Picks_and_Bans/Spring_Season/Spring_Season/Week_1)  up until around March, I believe that coincided with the mastery changes.  While his solo queue win rate is around [47%](http://loldb.gameguyz.com/statistics/winRate), he did receive recent buffs and is currently sitting at around [50% win rate](http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/champion/olaf/overview) in challenger.  I can't find solo queue data from the spring when he was competitively viable.

You'd still have to come with more than one champion if you want to build an argument against Riot's rework track record.

i didnt need more than one example to prove you wrong though 

>hey have never idly left a rework in a poor state.

i mean look at {{champion:14}} he's in a poor state, {{champion:6}} was garbage for friggen FOREVER, {{champion:3}} is still trash, {{champion:72}} is still strongly disliked by the people who liked him BEFORE the rework, {{champion:112}} needs some love... and thats just the few off the top of my head but there are your extra examples!

You misinterpreted the statement. This is considering the **already reworked** champions, not ones to recieve one.

Also, skarner is good, just needs his E to change IMO.

> What do you feel the character is losing because of this aspect of the passive? All characters have strengths and weaknesses and this is intended to accentuate her strengths and weaknesses.

She can't build health now and losing defense from defensive items isn't enough for you?  Or maybe that her W can't self target (but can target minions) and she loses health to heal others is going to be a problem/noob trap could be an issue that compounds this?  Or maybe the fact of which meta we are in and which junglers and mids are popular make this hugely scary as a soraka player for all these things once you add them up.

This passive in addition to others things is coming out as all weaknesses considering all factors.

If you make her viable for this meta once this dework goes live and her win rate hits 35%, she's going to be super toxic after the meta ends, morello is going to be QQing about her again, another huge nerf and drastic rework will happen, and we'll be back where we were earlier this season.  Which means we'll end up back where we are today with another group of Soraka fans being bitter and toxic towards Riot because a second wave of her fans will hate the next rework and it'll dredge up memories of this ill-conceived experiment.

Oh Linna, I'm glad to see that some thing never change. Our war shall never resolve!

On a serious note, I'm excited to crack open how to make a healer with gameplay in a PvP game. Vesh has worked very hard to try to make this a reality, and the previoust costs/downsides with things like blue healers or even other LoL champions don't do well when you give a character bonkers haling to friends. 

I've been against healing as a role a long time - I've learned my problems are with its execution and lack of decisions (for themselves or enemies) that's problematic. So, we've take a stab at fixing that. 

You should be scared as Soraka. You're trying to heal people who should kill people and protect people for you. You can still buy GA and have 80% of the value in defense. You're not going to have 4000 HP and 200 armor/100MR on Soraka. As a healer, being tanky WOULD be the natural build, so we have to prevent that case.

THIS can let us make a character who SUPPORTS by HEALING to an unprecendented degree in LoL. No one else can do this. You want support to change a game? You want new reasons to pick a character? I hear you - super clearly. 

It's not all buffs. It's hard ass choices.

She's A) getting her self heal both weakened and reliant on landing a skillshot, B) getting a MASSIVE %max health cost on her W, and C) is losing 20% of her bonus resistances.

She needs to have fucking amazing healing in order to balance 'Draven can one shot me.' Was simply giving her heal really shitty bases and large ap ratios, forcing her into buying AP instead of tank stats, not enough?
My guess is 70-80% AP ratio on her W every **2 seconds**. That not good enough?
.....I guess I'm the only one who is looking forward to playing the new kit.
And everyone who has asked for a healer archetype for 4 years :D
Woo, red response!

Well, I'm pretty open minded. (I actually still believe that blitz slowing down after his speed buff was an interesting and good mechanic.)

I still think that the raw stats you are asking of her will require either a massive amount of new support items, or push her into mid lane as sort of an inverse Karthus. Not that a Midlane inverse Karthus is a bad thing, I actually enjoy that thought.

Also, I believe that while balanced in appearance, the passive and W costs to prevent her from building tanky are both forced and dumb. If built tanky AP or support, she is making a viable choice one way or another, should Q be effective. Without Q being effective, she doesn't work at all. These forced mechanics don't actually discourage her, as resists are both very cheap compared to AP as a stat, and If she starts RoA+GA, she is pretty powerful immediately.
I agree on Blitz - my bad on that. A mistake in my mind.

No, it's more than numbers tuning.  It's the fact that she's [giving up too much](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/PPBWg2ms-a-brief-list-of-issues-with-the-soraka-rework) for people's liking.

I really wish you guys would just take the rework kit, put it on a new champ, and then try to fix Soraka again at a later date.  It's just too radical a change for it to be considered the same champ.

I think if this kit were put on a new champ, no one would be complaining like they are now and everyone wins.  Morello gets his infuse healer, soraka players don't see this abomination go live, and people who want a new champ get one with a fresh slate.  

RiotScruffy, let me put it to you like this.  Think of your main champ and all time favorite.  Now imagine that champ being broken mechanically and thematically in a way that's out of left field and has few correlations to your current champ.  You can't build that champ like you did before, you can't play that champ like you did before, it might now  even have a totally new lane or role in the game.  Now even though you might not hate this new kit, you are probably more than a little peeved that it is being slapped on  your favorite champ.

That's how some of us feel.  Look at my link, the old Soraka is an extremely dense champ in terms of what she brought into the game.  While some people liked her for her heal, she was more than a heal bot.  It is extremely frustrating to be trying to convey that and having you all sweep all of our thoughts and feelings under the rug like they never existed.  And then you (riot) want us to be happy about all this.

Take the Cass changes.  People are mad about those because you completely changed her concept around, she's not a poison champ anymore; she's a champ with 2 skills to mark the other guy for her E.  That's just wrong.  

I've been looking at some of the reworks and they aren't inspiring me.  A lot of them aren't hitting all the notes with the fans that they need to.  A lot of them feel like the red queen effect when you randomly choose not to run on them.  As a soraka player, this dework as I've been calling it is more in lines with running the wrong way.

Most of them aren't helping the champs they need to help out.  A lot of them aren't keeping the fans of the champ happy.  Some of them need another rework because you didn't fix the problem (evelynn) or you created new problems (nidalee according to many) or people stopped playing the champ until you buffed them a little afterward (ahri).

This doesn't even touch on the constant nerfs to top champs and the fact that bruisers vs ADCs is always a pendulum of who's the favorite this parch with none of the other classes stepping up to offer a rock paper scissors balance scenario.
I won't hold that against you.  Hell, if everyone copied you I would not have felt the need to post this.

I'll tell you how wrong you are! you're right :P! I agree with pretty much everything, what I don't agree with is the new kit for Soraka itself, I understand you're trying to look at the good instead of focusing on the bad but honestly I think she's gonna be dead weight once team fighting begins, even those who take the time to master her won't be of much use, she's one of the supports who can be overlooked if you happen to have grievous wound on your team, and we know how easy it is to get that... Soraka as she is on that kit happens to be just a heal bot, when you choose her you're literally playing against yourself (you hurt yourself for healing, and most of your targets are ally based)

Now I've been tinkering with the idea that she's made this way because of a reason, and that reason is: having 2 heals on her kit is simply over the top; the way I see it, Riot had 2 choices with Soraka, make one of her heals either difficult or counterproductive, they chose the latter but... what if... they made her heal difficult to land instead? like, a skillshot or a cone as Karma used to have... or hell, why don't they just scrap Astral blessing and merge it with her new Q, when she lands that tiny little star she heals not only herself but the closest ally, perhaps even not a heal but an aura of increased health regen around herself, W then would need to be filled by something else like a shield or magic resist buff of sorts...

I remember a time when Taric was the option against a heavy AD team and Soraka was the answer to a heavy Magic damage team, that identity went away a long time ago but I think this is an amazing oportunity to fill that niche, a skill in Soraka that passively makes her share her magic resist and reduce the enemy's, a starcall that affects only champions!

I rather an interactive champ than a champ that works against itself anyday ._. and those are my 2 cents xD

For the most part I can't argue whether or not this kit can work but I will point out about GW. It will be Soraka achilles heel. Luckily, Riot has stated they didn't like how GW currently works and are looking into weaning it out of the game or change it how it works. But as long as that ability is still in the game, it's gonna invalidate almost her entire kit. Then again, her healing is on a low CD so it might not be too bad of a thing.

Someone might have mentioned this: maybe items with GW effect should initially apply minor healing reduction to the victim which would increase with each spell and/or basic attack against them, and wear off quickly if left alone. That way one would have to choose whether to focus on disabling their sustain or take down someone else first, while those playing as sustain-heavy champion would have to be more careful about getting focused.

For example: first spell/attack applies 20% reduction for a few seconds. Dealing damage with basic attacks and spells would then increase the value to up to 60%, with basic attacks, DoT and AoE spells increasing it by small amount and instant damage single target spells increasing the reduction value faster. If target is not attacked for a few seconds, Healing reduction first drops back to minimal value, and if not attacked for a moment after that, debuff wears off completely. Alternatively, value would increase over time as long as they have taken damage in last ~2 seconds.

This way you can slightly debuff several opponents, but to really disable someone's sustain, you'd have to focus on them, which wouldn't always be a good idea.
Be mindful though, Morello, that GW still keeps champions like Warwick, Vlad, Mundo, and Swain from being overbearing. But GW can also make it difficult for those champions as well.
